oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1953-06-06 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from June 6, 1953. Featuring Jud Collins (announcer), Rex Allen (host/performer) and performers Minnie Pearl, Kitty Wells, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, the Old Hickory Singers, Rod Brasfield, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. Next week's guests announced as being Ernie Lee and Little Rita Faye.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Rod Brasfield; Rex Allen; Kitty Wells; Stringbean
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Prince Albert commercial -- Rex Allen introduces the Old Hickory Singers -- Old Grey Bonnet (Old Hickory Singers) -- Rex Allen introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Rex Allen) -- Rex Allen introduces Kitty Wells -- You Said You Could Do Without Me (Kitty Wells) -- Rex Allen introduces Stringbean -- Take Me Back To Tulsa (Stringbean) -- Rex Allen talks -- No One Will Ever Know (Rex Allen) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (Rex Allen) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Station announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); WNBC (Radio station : New York, N.Y.); Collins, Jud; Allen, Rex, 1920-1999; Old Hickory Singers; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Jackson, Tommy; Wells, Kitty; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961; Lee, Ernie, 1916-1991; Wilson, Rita Faye
